channel.title: Group Theory on David Burrell
channel.description: Recent content in Group Theory on David Burrell

item.title: Problem No. 2
item.description: If A and B are subgroups of finite index in a group G, and \(|G:A|\) and \(|G:B|\) are relatively prime, then \(G = AB\). Solution

item.title: Problem No. 1
item.description: If \( H \) is a subgroup fo finite index in a group \( G\), then \(H\) contains a subgroup \(N\) which is of finite index and normal in \(G\). Solution
